ReferenceBlocks.text: ROMANS

block.text: ROMANS

ReferenceBlocks.text: ROMANS 1
Paul, a servant of Jesus Christ our Lord, was called to be an apostle, set apart for the Good News of God.

block.text: İsa Mәsihin qulu, hәvari olmağa çağırılmış, Allahın Müjdәsini yaymaq üçün seçilmiş mәn Pauldan salam!

ReferenceBlocks.text: This Good News is that which he promised before through his prophets in the holy Scriptures,

block.text: Allahın Öz peyğәmbәrlәri vasitәsilә Müqәddәs Yazılarda әvvәlcәdәn vәd etdiyi o Müjdә

ReferenceBlocks.text: It concerns his Son, who was born of the seed of David according to the flesh.

block.text: It concerns his Son, who was born of the seed of David according to the flesh.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He was declared to be the Son of God with power, according to the Spirit of holiness, by the resurrection from the dead, Jesus Christ our Lord,

block.text: He was declared to be the Son of God with power, according to the Spirit of holiness, by the resurrection from the dead, Jesus Christ our Lord,

ReferenceBlocks.text: through whom we received grace and apostleship, for obedience of faith among all the nations, for his name’s sake;

block.text: Biz Onun vasitәsilә lütfә vә hәvariliyә nail olduq ki, Onun adı naminә bütün millәtlәrdәn olan insanları imana itaәt etmәyә çağıraq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: among whom you are also called to belong to Jesus Christ;

block.text: Siz dә İsa Mәsihә mәxsus olmaq üçün çağırılmış o insanların arasındasınız.

ReferenceBlocks.text: to all who are in Rome, beloved of God, called to be saints: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

block.text: to all who are in Rome, beloved of God, called to be saints: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

ReferenceBlocks.text: First, I thank my God through Jesus Christ for all of you, that your faith is proclaimed throughout the whole world.

block.text: Hәr şeydәn әvvәl, hamınız üçün İsa Mәsihin vasitәsilә Allahıma şükür edirәm ki, imanınız bütün dünyada elan olunur.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For God is my witness, whom I serve in my spirit in the Good News of his Son, how unceasingly I make mention of you always in my prayers.

block.text: Oğlunun Müjdәsini yaymaqda bütün qәlbimlә ibadәt etdiyim Allah şahidimdir ki, mәn sizi necә daim yada salıram.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I pray that at last, by God’s will, the way may be opened for me to visit you.

block.text: Dualarımda hәmişә yalvarıram ki, Allahın iradәsi ilә nәhayәt yanınıza gәlmәyә nail olum.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For I long to see you, that I may impart to you some spiritual gift, to the end that you may be established;

block.text: Çünki sizi qüvvәtlәndirmәk üçün sizә ruhani bir әnam çatdırmaq mәqsәdindәyәm; buna görә dә sizi görmәk üçün hәsrәt çәkirәm.

ReferenceBlocks.text: that is, that I with you may be encouraged in you, each of us by the other’s faith, both yours and mine.

block.text: Daha doğrusu, mәn aranızda olarkәn bir-birimizin imanı ilә qarşılıqlı halda ruhlanaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now I don’t desire to have you unaware, brothers, that I often planned to come to you, and was hindered so far, that I might have some fruit among you also, even as among the rest of the Gentiles.

block.text: Ey qardaşlar, bixәbәr olmağınızı istәmirәm ki, başqa millәtlәrdәn olan digәrlәri arasında etdiyim kimi sizin aranızda da әmәyimin bәhrәsini götürüm deyә dәfәlәrlә yanınıza gәlmәk niyyәtindә olmuşam, amma indiyәdәk maneәlәrә rast gәldim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I am debtor both to Greeks and to foreigners, both to the wise and to the foolish.

block.text: Mәn hәm Yunanlara, hәm dә barbarlara, hәm aqillәrә, hәm dә cahillәrә borcluyam.

ReferenceBlocks.text: So, as much as is in me, I am eager to preach the Good News to you also who are in Rome.

block.text: Bu sәbәbdәn mәn Romada yaşayan sizlәrә dә bacardığım qәdәr Müjdәni yaymağa hәvәsim var.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For I am not ashamed of the Good News of Christ, for it is the power of God for salvation for everyone who believes; for the Jew first, and also for the Greek.

block.text: Mәn Müjdәdәn utanmıram, çünki o, iman edәn hәr kәsin – әvvәlcә Yәhudinin, sonra da Yunanın xilası üçün Allahın qüdrәtidir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For in it is revealed God’s righteousness from faith to faith. As it is written,

block.text: Müjdәdә Allahın salehliyi aşkar olur vә bu salehlik tamamilә imanla әldә edilir. Necә ki yazılıb:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “But the righteous shall live by faith.”

block.text: <<Saleh adam imanla yaşayacaq>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For the wrath of God is revealed from heaven against all ungodliness and unrighteousness of men, who hold the truth in unrighteousness.

block.text: Hәqiqәtә haqsızlıqla әngәl törәdәn adamların hәr cür allahsızlığı vә haqsızlığı ucbatından Allahın qәzәbi göydәn aşkar olur.

ReferenceBlocks.text: That which is known of God is revealed in men for God revealed it to them.

block.text: Çünki Allah haqqında mәlum olan şeylәr onlara aşkardır, Allah Özü bunu onlara aşkar edib.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For the invisible things of him since the creation of the world are clearly seen, being perceived through the things that are made, even his everlasting power and divinity; that they may be without excuse.

block.text: Dünyanın yaradılışından bәri Allahın gözә görünmәyәn xüsusiyyәtlәri, yәni әbәdi qüdrәti vә ilahiliyi Onun yaratdıqları vasitәsilә üzә çıxır. Buna görә dә onlar üzrsüzdür.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Because, knowing God, they didn’t glorify him as God, neither did they give thanks. Instead, they became vain in their reasoning, and their senseless heart was darkened.

block.text: Adamlar Allahı tanıdıqları halda Ona nә Allah kimi izzәt verdilәr, nә dә şükür etdilәr. Әksinә, boş düşüncәlәrә uydular vә axmaq ürәklәrini qaranlıq bürüdü.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Professing themselves to be wise, they became fools.

block.text: Müdrik olduqlarını iddia etdiklәri halda ağılsız olub,

ReferenceBlocks.text: They traded the glory of the incorruptible God for the likeness of an image of corruptible man, and of birds, and four-footed animals, and creeping things.

block.text: fani olmayan Allahın izzәtini fani olan insana, quşlara, dördayaqlılara vә sürünәnlәrә bәnzәyәn bütlәrlә әvәz etdilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore God also gave them up in the lusts of their hearts to uncleanness, that their bodies should be dishonored among themselves.

block.text: Buna görә dә Allah onları ürәklәrinin şәhvәti üzündәn murdarlığa tәslim etdi ki, bir-birlәrinin bәdәnini rüsvay etsinlәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They exchanged the truth of God for a lie, and worshiped and served the creature rather than the Creator, who is blessed forever. Amen.

block.text: Onlar Allahın hәqiqәtini yalanla әvәz etdilәr, Yaradanın yerinә yaradılışa sәcdә vә ibadәt etdilәr; o Yaradana әbәdi alqış olsun! Amin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For this reason, God gave them up to vile passions. For their women changed the natural function into that which is against nature.

block.text: Bu sәbәbdәn Allah onları öz rәzil hәvәslәrinә tәslim etdi. Onların qadınları tәbii әlaqәni qeyri-tәbii әlaqә ilә әvәz etdilәr,

ReferenceBlocks.text: Likewise also the men, leaving the natural function of the woman, burned in their lust toward one another. They were doing what is inappropriate with men, and receiving in themselves the due penalty of their error.

block.text: eyni tәrzdә kişilәr dә qadınla olan tәbii әlaqәdәn әl çәkib bir-birlәrinә şәhvәtlә qızdılar; kişilәr kişilәrlә rüsvayçılıq edib öz daxillәrindә rәzilliklәrinә layiq cәzanı aldılar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Even as they refused to have God in their knowledge, God gave them up to a reprobate mind, to do those things which are not fitting.

block.text: Allahı şüurlarında saxlamağı yanlış saydıqları üçün Allah da onları yanlış düşüncәlәrә tәslim etdi ki, әdәbsiz işlәr görsünlәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They are filled with all unrighteousness, sexual immorality, wickedness, covetousness, malice; full of envy, murder, strife, deceit, evil habits, secret slanderers,

block.text: Onlar hәr cür haqsızlıq, pislik, tamahkarlıq vә kinlә doldular; paxıllıq, qatillik, münaqişә ruhu, hiylә vә pis niyyәtlә dolub-daşdılar. Onlar qeybәtçi,

ReferenceBlocks.text: backbiters, hateful to God, insolent, haughty, boastful, inventors of evil things, disobedient to parents,

block.text: böhtançı, Allaha nifrәt edәn, söyüşçü, mәğrur, tәkәbbürlü, pis işlәrdә bacarıqlı, ata-anaya itaәtsiz,

ReferenceBlocks.text: without understanding, covenant breakers, without natural affection, unforgiving, unmerciful;

block.text: axmaq, xain, şәfqәtsiz vә rәhmsizdir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They know that God said that those who practice such things are worthy of death. Yet not only do they do them, they also approve of others who practice them.

block.text: Hәrçәnd ki belә işlәrlә mәşğul olanların ölümә layiq olduğu barәdә Allahın әdalәtli hökmünü bilirlәr, amma yenә dә bu işlәri görürlәr, hәtta belә işlәr görәn başqalarını da alqışlayırlar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ROMANS 2
Therefore you are without excuse, O man, whoever you are who judge. For in that which you judge another, you condemn yourself. For you who judge practice the same things.

block.text: Belәliklә, sәn ey başqasını mühakimә edәn adam, kim olursansa-ol, sәn dә üzrsüzsәn. Çünki başqasını mühakimә edәrkәn özünü dә mәhkum edirsәn. Ona görә ki başqasını mühakimә etdiyin halda özün dә hәmin işlәri görürsәn.

ReferenceBlocks.text: We know that the judgment of God is according to truth against those who practice such things.

block.text: Bizsә bilirik ki, belә işlәrlә mәşğul olanlara Allah hәqiqәtә әsasәn hökm çıxarır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Do you think this, O man who judges those who practice such things, and do the same, that you will escape the judgment of God?

block.text: Ey belә işlәrlә mәşğul olanları mühakimә edәrәk özü dә hәmin işlәri görәn insan! Mәgәr elә güman edirsәn ki, Allahın hökmündәn qaça bilәcәksәn?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Will you ignore the wealth of His mercy, his patience and his broad-mindedness? Do you not know that God’s purpose of grace is to lead you to repentance?

block.text: Yaxud sәn Allahın zәngin xeyirxahlığına, hәlimliyinә vә sәbirli olmağına xor baxırsan? Bәs anlamırsan ki, Onun xeyirxahlığı sәni tövbәyә yönәldir?

ReferenceBlocks.text: But according to your hardness and unrepentant heart you are treasuring up for yourself wrath in the day of wrath, revelation, and of the righteous judgment of God;

block.text: Amma sәn Allahın qәzәbinin vә әdalәtli hökmünün zahir olacağı gün inadkarlığına vә tövbә etmәyәn ürәyinә görә özün üçün qәzәb toplayırsan;

ReferenceBlocks.text: He will pay back to everyone according to their works:

block.text: Allah hәr kәsә әmәlinә görә әvәzini verәcәk:

ReferenceBlocks.text: Those who by patience in well-doing seek for glory, honor, and incorruptibility, they will receive eternal life.

block.text: dözümlә yaxşı әmәl sahibi olaraq izzәt, hörmәt vә ölmәzlik axtaranlara әbәdi hәyat,

ReferenceBlocks.text: But to those who are self-seeking, and don’t obey the truth, but obey unrighteousness, there will be wrath and indignation.

block.text: özlәrini göstәrәrәk hәqiqәtә tabe olmayıb haqsızlığa baş әyәnlәrә isә qәzәb vә hiddәt göndәrәcәk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Oppression and anguish will be on every soul of man who works evil, to the Jew first, and also to the Greek.

block.text: Pislik edәn hәr kәsә – әvvәlcә Yәhudiyә, sonra da Yunana әziyyәt vә sıxıntı,

ReferenceBlocks.text: But glory, honor, and peace go to every man who works good, to the Jew first, and also to the Greek.

block.text: yaxşı әmәl sahibi olan hәr kәsә isә – әvvәlcә Yәhudiyә, sonra da başqa millәtdәn olana izzәt, hörmәt vә sülh verәcәk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For there is no partiality with God.

block.text: Çünki Allah insanlar arasında tәrәfkeşlik etmәz.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For as many as have sinned without law will also perish without the law. As many as have sinned under the law will be judged by the law.

block.text: Qanunu bilmәdәn günah edәnlәrin hamısı Qanunu bilmәsәlәr dә, hәlak olacaqlar. Qanunu bilәrәk günah edәnlәrin dә hamısı Qanunla mühakimә olunacaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For it isn’t the hearers of the law who are righteous before God, but the doers of the law will be justified.

block.text: Çünki Allahın nәzәrindә Qanunu eşidәnlәr deyil, ona әmәl edәnlәr saleh sayılır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: (For when Gentiles who don’t have the law do by nature the things of the law, they are a law to themselves, even though they do not have the law.

block.text: Belәcә Qanuna malik olmayan başqa millәtlәr tәbiәtlәrinә görә Qanuna әmәl edәndә Qanuna malik olmadıqları halda onlar özlәri üçün qanun olur.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They show that the work of the law is written in their hearts. Their conscience testifies with them and their thoughts among themselves accusing or else excusing them).

block.text: Onlar bununla göstәrirlәr ki, Qanunun tәlәblәri ürәklәrindә yazılıb. Onların vicdanı buna şahiddir, düşüncәlәri dә onları gah ittiham, gah da müdafiә edir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: There will be a day when God will judge the secrets of men, according to the Good News that I preach.

block.text: Mәnim elan etdiyim Müjdәyә görә, Allahın Mәsih İsa vasitәsilә insanların gizli işlәrini mühakimә edәcәyi gün belә olacaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Indeed you bear the name of a Jew, and rest on the law, and glory in God.

block.text: Ey özünü Yәhudi adlandıran! Qanuna güvәnәrәk Allahla öyünürsәn;

ReferenceBlocks.text: You know his will, and approve the things that are excellent, being instructed out of the law.

block.text: Onun iradәsini bilirsәn, Qanundan tәlim aldığın üçün әn üstün dәyәrlәri ayırd edirsәn;

ReferenceBlocks.text: You are confident that you yourself are a guide of the blind, a light to those who are in darkness.

block.text: You are confident that you yourself are a guide of the blind, a light to those who are in darkness.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You think you are a corrector of the foolish, a teacher of babies, having in the law the form of knowledge and of the truth.

block.text: You think you are a corrector of the foolish, a teacher of babies, having in the law the form of knowledge and of the truth.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You therefore who teach another, don’t you teach yourself? You who preach that a man shouldn’t steal, do you steal?

block.text: Bәs nә üçün başqalarını öyrәtdiyin halda özün öyrәnmirsәn? Oğurlamamağı bәyan edәrkәn özün oğurlayırsan?

ReferenceBlocks.text: You who say a man shouldn’t commit adultery. Do you commit adultery? You who abhor idols, do you rob temples?

block.text: <<Zina etmә>>dediyin halda özün zina edirsәn? Bütlәrdәn iyrәnәrkәn mәbәdlәri soyursan?

ReferenceBlocks.text: You who glory in the law, through your disobedience of the law do you dishonor God?
For just as it is written:

block.text: Qanunla öyünmәyinә baxmayaraq, onu pozub Allahı hörmәtdәn salırsan.
Axı belә yazılıb:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “the name of God is blasphemed among the Gentiles because of you,”

block.text: <<Sizin üzünüzdәn millәtlәr arasında Allahın adına küfr edilir>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For circumcision indeed profits, if you are a doer of the law. But if you are a transgressor of the law, your circumcision has become uncircumcision.

block.text: Sünnәtin yalnız o zaman faydası var ki, sәn Qanuna әmәl edәsәn. Әgәr sәn Qanunu pozursansa, sünnәtli olduğun halda sünnәtsiz adam kimi olursan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If therefore the uncircumcised keep the ordinances of the law, won’t his uncircumcision be accounted as circumcision?

block.text: Elәcә dә әgәr sünnәt olunmamış adam Qanunun әdalәtli tәlәblәrinә riayәt edirsә, sünnәt olunmamasına baxmayaraq, sünnәtli sayılır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Won’t the uncircumcision which is by nature, if it fulfills the law, judge you, who with the letter and circumcision are a transgressor of the law?

block.text: Onda cismәn sünnәt olunmadığı halda Qanuna әmәl edәn adam sәni mühakimә edәcәk; sәn ki yazılı Qanuna vә sünnәtә malik olduğun halda Qanunu pozursan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For he is not a Jew who is one outwardly, neither is that circumcision which is outward in the flesh;

block.text: Çünki zahirәn Yәhudi olan Yәhudi deyil, zahirәn vә cismәn sünnәt olunan da sünnәtli deyil.

ReferenceBlocks.text: but he is a Jew who is one inwardly, and circumcision is that of the heart. It is in the spirit not in the letter; His praise is not from men, but from God.

block.text: but he is a Jew who is one inwardly, and circumcision is that of the heart. It is in the spirit not in the letter; His praise is not from men, but from God.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ROMANS 3
Then what advantage does the Jew have? Or what is the profit of circumcision?

block.text: Bәs Yәhudi olmağın nә üstünlüyü var? Sünnәtin faydası nәdir?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Much in every way! Because first of all, they were entrusted with the oracles of God.

block.text: Hәr cәhәtdәn böyük üstünlüyü var. Hәr şeydәn әvvәl, Allahın sözlәri Yәhudilәrә әmanәt edilib.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For what if some were without faith? Will their lack of faith nullify the faithfulness of God?

block.text: Әgәr onlardan bәzisi iman etmәdisә, onda nә olacaq? Mәgәr onların imansızlığı Allahın sәdaqәtini lәğv edә bilәr?

ReferenceBlocks.text: May it never be! Yes, let God be found true, but every man a liar. As it is written,

block.text: Әsla! Bütün insanlar yalançı olsa da, Allah haqlıdır. Necә ki yazılıb:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “That you might be justified in your words, and might prevail when you come into judgment.”

block.text: <<Sәn Öz sözlәrindә haqlı çıxacaqsan, Mühakimә etdiyin zaman qalib gәlәcәksәn>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But if our unrighteousness commends the righteousness of God, what will we say? Is God unrighteous who inflicts wrath? I speak like men do.

block.text: Bәs bizim haqsızlığımız Allahın әdalәtli olduğunu üzә çıxarırsa, onda nә deyә bilәrik? İnsanların düşündüyü kimi soruşuram: Allah üzәrimizә qәzәbini gәtirәn zaman haqsızdırmı?

ReferenceBlocks.text: May it never be! For then how will God judge the world?

block.text: Әsla, haqlıdır! Bәs Allah dünyanı başqa cür necә mühakimә edә bilәr?

ReferenceBlocks.text: For if the truth of God through my lie abounded to his glory, why am I also still judged as a sinner?

block.text: <<Bәs mәnim yalanım Allahın hәqiqәtini ucaldıb Ona izzәt gәtirirsә, nә üçün mәn üstәlik bir günahkar kimi mühakimә olunmalıyam?>> deyә soruşa bilәrlәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Why not (as we are slanderously reported, and as some affirm that we say), “Let us do evil, that good may come?” Those who say so are justly condemned.

block.text: Belә isә, <<gәlin pislik edәk ki, bundan yaxşılıq әmәlә gәlsin>> deyә bilәrikmi? Bәzi adamlar bizә böhtan atıb söylәyir ki, biz belә öyrәdirik. Belә söylәyәnlәr haqlı olaraq cәza alacaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: What then? Are we better than they? No, in no way! For we previously warned both Jews and Greeks, that they are all under sin.
As it is written,

block.text: Bәs nә deyәk? Biz Yәhudilәrin üstünlüyü varmı? Әlbәttә, yox! Çünki biz artıq hәm Yәhudilәri, hәm dә Yunanları tәqsirlәndirdik ki, onların hamısı günahın hökmü altındadır.
Necә ki yazılıb:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “There is no one righteous; no, not one.
There is no one who understands. There is no one who seeks after God.

block.text: <<Saleh olan yoxdur, Bir nәfәr belә, yoxdur.
Dәrk edәn bir kәs yoxdur, Allahı axtaran yoxdur.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They have all turned aside. They have together become unprofitable. There is no one who does good, no, not, so much as one.”

block.text: Hamısı yoldan azıb, Onlardan fayda yoxdur. Bir nәfәr dә olsun Yaxşı iş görәn yoxdur>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Their throat is an open tomb. With their tongues they have used deceit.” “The poison of vipers is under their lips”;
“whose mouth is full of cursing and bitterness.”

block.text: <<Boğazları açıq qәbirdir, Dillәri yalan danışır>>. <<Dodaqlarında gürzә zәhәri var>>
<<Ağızları lәnәt vә acı sözlәrlә doludur>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Their feet are swift to shed blood.
Destruction and misery are in their ways.

block.text: <<Ayaqları qan tökmәyә tәlәsir,
Yollarında viranәlik vә fәlakәt var,

ReferenceBlocks.text: The way of peace, they haven’t known.”
“There is no fear of God before their eyes.”

block.text: Әmin-amanlıq yolu nәdir, bilmirlәr>>.
<<Onların gözündә Allah qorxusu yoxdur>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now we know that whatever things the law says, it speaks to those who are under the law. No one can say that he does not know what sin is, and all the world may be held accountable to the judgment of God.

block.text: Biz bilirik ki, Qanunda deyilәnlәrin hamısı Qanunun hökmü altında olanlara aiddir; belә ki bütün dillәr sussun vә bütün dünya Allahın hökmünә mәruz qalsın.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Because by the works of the law, no flesh will be justified in his sight. For through the law comes the knowledge of sin.

block.text: Belәliklә, Qanuna әmәl etmәklә heç bir insan Allahın önündә saleh sayılmayacaq. Çünki Qanun vasitәsilә günah dәrk olunur.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But now apart from the law, a righteousness of God has been revealed, being testified by the law and the prophets;

block.text: Amma indi Qanuna bağlı olmayaraq Allahdan gәlәn salehlik zahir olub. Buna Qanun da, Peyğәmbәrlәrin yazıları da şәhadәt edir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: This righteousness of God comes through faith in Jesus Christ to all and on all those who believe. For there is no distinction.

block.text: Allahdan gәlәn bu salehlik İsa Mәsihә iman vasitәsilә Ona iman gәtirәnlәrin hamısına verilir. Heç kәsә fәrq qoyulmur.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For all have sinned, and fall short of the glory of God;

block.text: Çünki hamı günah edib, Allahın izzәtindәn mәhrum olub

ReferenceBlocks.text: Anyone can be justified freely by his grace through the redemption that is in Christ Jesus.

block.text: vә Onun lütfü ilә dә Mәsih İsada satın alınmağa nail olaraq bir hәdiyyә kimi saleh sayılır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: God gave him to be an atoning sacrifice, through faith in his blood, for a demonstration of his righteousness through the passing over of prior sins, in God’s forbearance;

block.text: Allah İsanı kәffarә qurbanı olaraq tәqdim etdi ki, iman edәnlәrin günahları Onun qanı vasitәsilә bağışlansın. Bunu Öz salehliyini göstәrmәk üçün etdi. Çünki sәbirli olub qabaqca edilәn günahları cәzasız qoymuşdu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: God demonstrates his righteousness at this present time; that he might himself be just, and the justifier of him who has faith in Jesus.

block.text: Bunu etdi ki, indiki zamanda salehliyini zahir etsin; belәcә Özü әdalәtli olsun, İsaya olan imana әsaslananı da saleh saysın.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Where then is the boasting? It is excluded. By what kind of law? Of works? No, but by a law of faith.

block.text: Bәs biz nә ilә öyünә bilәrik? Heç bir şeylә. Hansı ehkama әsaslana bilәrik? Qanuna әmәl etmәk ehkamınamı? Xeyr, yalnız iman ehkamına!

ReferenceBlocks.text: We maintain therefore that a man is justified by faith apart from the works of the law.

block.text: Çünki bu nәticәyә gәlirik ki, insan Qanuna әmәl etmәklә deyil, iman vasitәsilә saleh sayılır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Or is God the God of Jews only? Isn’t he the God of Gentiles also? Yes, of Gentiles also.

block.text: Mәgәr Allah yalnız Yәhudilәrin Allahıdır? Başqa millәtlәrin dә Allahı deyilmi? Әlbәttә, başqa millәtlәrin dә Allahıdır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Indeed there is one God who will justify the circumcised by faith, and the uncircumcised through faith.

block.text: Çünki yalnız bir Allah var vә O, sünnәtlilәri imanla, sünnәtsizlәri dә iman vasitәsilә saleh sayacaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Do we then nullify the law through faith? May it never be! No, we establish the law.

block.text: Onda biz iman vasitәsilә Qanunu lәğv edirikmi? Әsla! Әksinә, onu bir daha tәsdiq edirik.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ROMANS 4
What then will we say that Abraham, our forefather, has found according to the flesh?

block.text: Bәs onda cismani әcdadımız İbrahim haqqında nә deyә bilәrik? O nә әldә etdi?

ReferenceBlocks.text: For if Abraham was justified by works, he has something to boast about, but not toward God.
For what does the Scripture say?

block.text: Әgәr İbrahim öz әmәllәri ilә saleh sayılsaydı, öyünmәyә haqqı olardı, amma Allahın önündә yox.
Müqәddәs Yazı nә deyir?

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Abraham believed God, and it was accounted to him for righteousness.”

block.text: i <<İbrahim Allaha iman etdi vә bu ona salehlik sayıldı>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now to him who works, the reward is not counted as grace, but as something owed.

block.text: Әmәl edәnin muzdu ona hәdiyyә sayılmaz, bu onun haqqıdır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But to him who doesn’t work, but believes in him who justifies the ungodly, his faith is accounted for righteousness.

block.text: Lakin әmәl etmәyib allahsız adamları saleh sayan Allaha iman edәn şәxsin imanı ona salehlik sayılır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Even as David also pronounces blessing on the man to whom God counts righteousness apart from works.
David said:

block.text: Davud da o adamın bәxtiyarlığından danışır ki, Allah әmәlinә baxmayıb onu saleh sayır.
Davud dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Blessed are they whose iniquities are forgiven, whose sins are covered.

block.text: <<Üsyankarlığı bağışlanan, Günahı әfv olunan insan Nә bәxtiyardır!

ReferenceBlocks.text: Blessed is the man whom the Lord will by no means charge with sin.”

block.text: Rәbb tәrәfindәn tәqsirkar sayılmayan insan Nә bәxtiyardır!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Is this blessing then pronounced on the circumcised, or on the uncircumcised also? For we say that faith was accounted to Abraham for righteousness.

block.text: Mәgәr bu bәxtiyarlıq yalnız sünnәtlilәrә mәxsusdur, yoxsa sünnәtsizlәrә dә aiddir? Bәli, biz deyirik ki, İbrahimin imanı ona salehlik sayıldı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: How then was it counted? When he was in circumcision, or in uncircumcision? Not in circumcision, but in uncircumcision.

block.text: Nә vәziyyәtdә sayıldı? Sünnәt olunandan sonra, yoxsa sünnәt olunandan әvvәl? Sünnәt olunandan sonra deyil, sünnәt olunandan әvvәl!

ReferenceBlocks.text: He received the sign of circumcision, a seal of the righteousness of the faith which he had while he was in uncircumcision. In this way Abraham is the spiritual father of all those who believe, though they might be in uncircumcision, that righteousness might also be accounted to them.

block.text: O, sünnәtsiz ikәn imanla malik olduğu salehliyi tәsdiq edәn möhür olaraq sünnәt әlamәtini aldı. Belәcә İbrahim sünnәtsiz olaraq iman edәn hamının atası oldu ki, onlara da imanları salehlik sayılsın.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He is the father of circumcision to those who not only are of the circumcision, but who also walk in the steps of that faith of our father Abraham, which he had in uncircumcision.

block.text: Atamız İbrahim hәm dә o sünnәtli olanların atası oldu ki, sadәcә sünnәtli olmaqla qalmayıb, onun sünnәt edilmәmişdәn әvvәl malik olduğu iman izi ilә gedirlәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: God promised Abraham and his descendants that they would be heirs to the world. This promise was made not because Abraham had obeyed the law *, but because he believed in God and had been accepted by him.

block.text: God promised Abraham and his descendants that they would be heirs to the world. This promise was made not because Abraham had obeyed the law *, but because he believed in God and had been accepted by him.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For if those who are of the law are heirs, faith is made void, and the promise is made of no effect.

block.text: Әgәr Qanuna әsaslananlar varis olsaydı, onda iman mәnasız, vәd dә tәsirsiz olardı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For the law works wrath, for where there is no law, neither is there disobedience.

block.text: Çünki qanun Allahın qәzәbini üzә çıxarır. Amma qanun olmayan yerdә onun pozulması da olmur.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore, God’s promise depends on faith, in order that the promise may be guaranteed as God’s gift to all the descendants of Abraham.

block.text: Therefore, God's promise depends on faith, in order that the promise may be guaranteed as God's gift to all the descendants of Abraham.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It is not only for those who obey the law but also for those who believe as Abraham believed in God because he is the spiritual father of us all.
* As the Scriptures say:

block.text: It is not only for those who obey the law but also for those who believe as Abraham believed in God because he is the spiritual father of us all.
* As the Scriptures say:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I have made you a father of many nations.”

block.text: <<Sәni çoxlu millәtin atası etdim>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Abraham is our father in the sight of God, in whom he believed --- The God who gives life to the dead, and calls the things that are not, as though they were.

block.text: İbrahim Allahın dərgahında kimə o iman Ata ki, --- olmayan olan Allah kimin ölü həyat verir, və zəng əşyalar, onlar sanki.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Who in hope believed against hope, to the end that he might become a father of many nations, according to that which had been spoken,

block.text: Heç bir ümid olmadığı halda İbrahim çoxlu millәtin atası olacağına ümidlә inandı. Çünki ona deyilmişdi ki,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “So will your seed be.”

block.text: <<nәslin o qәdәr olacaq>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Without being weakened in faith, he didn’t consider his own body, already having been worn out, (he being about a hundred years old), and the deadness of Sarah’s womb.

block.text: Hәtta tәxminәn yüz yaşında ikәn öz bәdәninin artıq ölüyә bәnzәdiyini, arvadı Saranın da bәtninin ölü olduğunu anladı, amma imanı azalmadı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Yet, looking to the promise of God, he didn’t waver through unbelief, but grew strong through faith, giving glory to God.

block.text: Allahın vәdinә imansızlıqla şübhә etmәdi, әksinә, imanında möhkәm durub Allahı izzәtlәndirdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He was fully assured that what God had promised, God was also able to perform.

block.text: Tamamilә әmin idi ki, Allah verdiyi vәdi yerinә yetirmәyә dә qadirdir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore it also was “reckoned to him for righteousness.”

block.text: Buna görә dә imanı ona salehlik sayıldı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now it was not written that it was accounted to him for his sake alone.

block.text: <<Salehlik sayıldı>> sözlәri yalnız İbrahim üçün yazılmayıb;

ReferenceBlocks.text: It was accounted for our sake also, to whom it will be accounted, who believe in him who raised Jesus, our Lord, from the dead.

block.text: Rәbbimiz İsanı ölülәr arasından Dirildәnә iman etmәklә saleh sayılacaq bizlәr üçün dә belә yazılmışdır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus was delivered up for our trespasses, and was raised for our justification.

block.text: İsa bizim tәqsirlәrimizә görә ölümә tәslim edildi vә bizim saleh sayılmağımız üçün dirildi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ROMANS 5
Being therefore justified by faith, we have peace with God through our Lord Jesus Christ;

block.text: Belәliklә, imanla saleh sayıldığımız üçün Rәbbimiz İsa Mәsih vasitәsilә Allahla barışmış oluruq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Through Jesus we also have our access, by faith, into this grace in which we stand. We rejoice in hope of the glory of God.

block.text: Elә Mәsihin vasitәsilә dә daxilindә qaldığımız lütfә imanla nail olduq vә Allahın izzәtinә ümid bağlamağımızla fәxr edirik.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Not only this, but we also rejoice in our sufferings, knowing that suffering works perseverance;
and perseverance, proven character; and proven character, hope:

block.text: Yalnız bununla deyil, çәkdiyimiz әziyyәtlәrlә dә fәxr edirik, çünki bilirik ki, әziyyәtdәn dözüm,
dözümdәn Allaha xoş gәlmә, Allaha xoş gәlmәdәn ümid yaranır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: and hope doesn’t disappoint us, because God’s love has been poured out into our hearts through the Holy Spirit who was given to us.

block.text: Ümidimiz dә boşa çıxmır, çünki Allah mәhәbbәti bizә verilәn Müqәddәs Ruh vasitәsilә ürәklәrimizә tökülüb.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For while we were yet weak, at the right time Christ died for the ungodly.

block.text: Biz hәlә gücsüz ikәn Mәsih müәyyәn zamanda allahsız adamların uğrunda öldü.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For one will hardly die for a righteous man. Yet perhaps for a righteous person someone would even dare to die.

block.text: Saleh bir adam uğrunda kiminsә ölmәsi çәtin işdir; bәlkә dә yaxşı bir adam uğrunda kimsә ölmәyә cәsarәt edәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But God commends his own love toward us, in that while we were yet sinners, Christ died for us.

block.text: Lakin Allah bizә olan mәhәbbәtini bununla sübut edir ki, biz hәlә günahkar ola-ola Mәsih bizim uğrumuzda öldü.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Much more then, being now justified by his blood, we will be saved from God’s wrath through him.

block.text: Belәcә Onun qanı ilә indi saleh sayıldığımıza görә Onun vasitәsilә dә Allahın qәzәbindәn mütlәq xilas olacağıq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For if, while we were enemies, we were reconciled to God through the death of his Son, much more, being reconciled, we will be saved by his life.

block.text: Әgәr biz Allahın düşmәni olduğumuz vaxt Onun Oğlunun ölmәsi ilә Allahla barışdıqsa, barışdıqdan sonra Onun hәyatı vasitәsilә daha qәti olaraq xilas olacağıq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Not only so, but we also rejoice in God through our Lord Jesus Christ, through whom we have now received the reconciliation.

block.text: Yalnız bununla deyil, Rәbbimiz İsa Mәsih vasitәsilә Allahla da fәxr edirik ki, indi Onun vasitәsilә Allahla barışığa nail olmuşuq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Sin entered the world through one man, and his sin brought death. As a result, death has spread throughout the whole human race because everyone has sinned.

block.text: Belәliklә, günah bir insan vasitәsilә, ölüm dә günah vasitәsilә bu dünyaya gәldi. Belәcә ölüm bütün insanlara yayıldı, çünki hamı günah etdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For until the law, sin was in the world; but sin is not charged when there is no law.

block.text: Qanundan әvvәl dә dünyada günah var idi. Amma qanun olmayanda günah hesaba alınmır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Nevertheless death reigned from Adam until Moses, even over those whose sins weren’t like Adam’s disobedience, who is a foreshadowing of him who was to come.

block.text: Lakin Adәmdәn Musaya qәdәr ölüm hamıya, hәtta Adәmin әmri pozmasına bәnzәr bir günah etmәyәnlәrә dә hökmranlıq etdi. Adәm o gәlәcәk İnsanın әvvәlcәdәn göstәrilәn tәsviri idi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the free gift isn’t like the trespass. For if by the trespass of the one the many died, much more did the grace of God, and the gift by the grace of the one man, Jesus Christ, abound to the many.

block.text: Amma Allahın әnamı tәqsir kimi deyil. Çünki bir adamın tәqsiri üzündәn çox adam öldüsә dә, Allahın lütfü vә bir Adamın, yәni İsa Mәsihin lütfü ilә verilәn әnam bir çoxları üçün daha böyük tәsir göstәrdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The gift is not as through one who sinned: for the judgment came by one to condemnation, but the free gift came of many trespasses to justification.

block.text: Allahın әnamı hәmin bir adamın günahının nәticәsi kimi deyil: bir günahdan sonra gәlәn hökm mәhkumluq gәtirdi, amma çoxlu tәqsirdәn sonra gәlәn әnam salehlik gәtirdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For if by the trespass of the one, death reigned through the one, so much more will those who receive the abundance of grace and of the gift of righteousness reign in life through the one, Jesus Christ.

block.text: Әgәr bir adamın tәqsiri üzündәn ölüm hәmin adamın vasitәsilә hökmranlıq etdisә, Allahın bol lütfünü vә salehlik әnamını qәbul edәnlәr bir Adam, yәni İsa Mәsih vasitәsilә daha qәti olaraq hәyatda hökmranlıq edәcәk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: So then as through one trespass, all men were condemned; even so through one act of righteousness, all men were justified to life.

block.text: Demәli, necә ki bir tәqsir üzündәn bütün adamlar mәhkum olundu, elәcә dә bir saleh әmәlә görә bütün adamlara yaşamaq üçün salehlik verildi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For as through the one man’s disobedience many were made sinners, even so through the obedience of the one, many will be made righteous.

block.text: Necә ki bir adamın itaәtsizliyi üzündәn bir çoxları günahkar sayıldı, elәcә dә bir Adamın itaәti sayәsindә bir çoxları saleh sayılacaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The law came in besides, that the trespass might abound; but where sin abounded, grace abounded more exceedingly.

block.text: Qanunun meydana gәlmәsi tәqsirin çoxalmasına sәbәb oldu. Lakin günah çoxalan yerdә Allahın lütfü daha da çoxaldı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As sin reigned in death, even so grace might reign through righteousness to eternal life through Jesus Christ our Lord.

block.text: Nәticәdә günah ölüm vasitәsilә hökmranlıq etdiyi kimi lütf dә salehlik vasitәsilә hökmranlıq edir; belә ki lütf Rәbbimiz İsa Mәsihin vasitәsilә әbәdi hәyat versin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ROMANS 6
What shall we say then? Shall we continue in sin, that grace may abound?

block.text: Bәs nә deyә bilәrik? Günah işlәtmәyi davam etdirәk ki, Allahın lütfü çoxalsın?

ReferenceBlocks.text: May it never be! We who died to sin, how could we live in it any longer?

block.text: Әsla! İndi ki biz günaha münasibәtdә ölmüşük, artıq günah içindә necә yaşaya bilәrik?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Or don’t you know that all we who were baptized into Christ Jesus were baptized into his death?

block.text: Mәgәr bilmirsiniz ki, biz hamımız Mәsih İsa ilә birlәşmәk üçün vәftiz olunarkәn hәmin vәftizlә Onun ölümü ilә birlәşdik?

ReferenceBlocks.text: So when we were baptized, we were buried with him because we died with him. And therefore, just as Christ was raised by the power of the glorious Father, we too may live a new life.

block.text: Demәli, vәftiz olunub Onun ölümü ilә birlәşmәklә biz dә Onunla birgә dәfn olunduq; belә ki Atanın izzәti ilә Mәsih ölülәr arasından dirildiyi kimi biz dә hәmin cür yeni hәyat sürәk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For if we have become united with him in the likeness of his death, we will also be part of his resurrection.

block.text: Әgәr Onun ölümünә bәnzәr ölümdә Onunla bir olmuşuqsa, Onun dirilmәsinә bәnzәr dirilmәdә dә Onunla bir olacağıq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: We know this, that our old man was crucified with him, that the body of sin might be done away with, so that we would no longer be in bondage to sin.

block.text: Bunu bilirik ki, günahlı bәdәnin aradan qaldırılması üçün, daha günaha qul olmayaq deyә köhnә mәnliyimiz Onunla birlikdә çarmıxa çәkildi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For he who has died has been freed from sin.

block.text: Çünki ölmüş adam günahdan azad olub.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But if we be dead with Christ, we believe that we will also live with him.

block.text: Әgәr Mәsihlә ölmüşüksә, Onunla yaşayacağımıza da inanırıq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: We know that Christ, being raised from the dead, dies no more. Death no more has dominion over him!

block.text: Çünki bilirik ki, Mәsih ölülәr arasından dirildiyinә görә bir daha ölmәyәcәk vә ölüm Ona artıq hökmranlıq etmәz.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For the death that he died, he died to sin one time; but the life that he lives, he lives to God.

block.text: Onun ölümü günahın müqabilindә ilk vә son ölüm oldu, yaşadığı hәyatı isә Allah üçün yaşayır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Thus consider yourselves also to be dead to sin, but alive to God in Christ Jesus our Lord.

block.text: Belәcә siz dә özünüzü Mәsih İsada olaraq günaha münasibәtdә ölü, Allaha münasibәtdә isә diri sayın.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore don’t let sin reign in your mortal body, that you should obey it in its lusts.

block.text: Ona görә dә qoymayın ki, günah sizin fani bәdәninizә hökmranlıq etsin vә siz dә bәdәninizin ehtiraslarına itaәt edәsiniz.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Neither present your members to sin as instruments of unrighteousness. Rather, present yourselves to God, as alive from the dead, and your members as instruments of righteousness to God.

block.text: Bәdәninizin üzvlәrini dә haqsızlıq alәti olmaq üçün günaha tәslim etmәyin; әksinә, özünüzü ölülәr arasından dirilәnlәr kimi Allaha, bәdәninizin üzvlәrini dә salehlik alәti olmaq üçün yenә Allaha tәslim edin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For sin will not have dominion over you. For you are not under law, but under grace.

block.text: Günah sizә hökmranlıq etmәyәcәk, ona görә ki siz Qanun altında deyil, lütf altındasınız.

ReferenceBlocks.text: What then? Shall we sin, because we are not under law, but under grace? May it never be!

block.text: İndi nә edәk? Qanun altında deyil, lütf altında olduğumuz üçün günah edәkmi? Әsla!

ReferenceBlocks.text: You do not know this? When you are put in the service of someone as slaves, you are slaves of the master whom you obey. So, either you are slaves to sin, and sin leads you to death, or you are servants of God, and God makes you righteous because you obey him.

block.text: Mәgәr bilmirsiniz ki, itaәtli qullar kimi özünüzü kimә tәslim etsәniz, onun da qullarısınız? Ya ölümә aparan günahın ya da salehliyә aparan itaәtin qulları ola bilәrsiniz.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But thanks be to God, that, whereas you were bondservants of sin, you became obedient from the heart to that form of teaching whereunto you were delivered.

block.text: Amma Allaha şükür olsun ki, әvvәllәr günahın qulları olduğunuz halda özünüzü hәsr etdiyiniz tәlimin nümunәsinә ürәkdәn itaәt etdiniz.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Being made free from sin, you became bondservants of righteousness.

block.text: Belәcә günahdan azad olub salehliyin qulu oldunuz.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I use a human comparison because you have trouble understanding. Formerly, as slaves, you put your body in the service of an immoral life and ever increasing wickedness, and the result was disobedience to God.

block.text: Cismani tәbiәtinizin zәifliyi üzündәn insanların düşündüyü kimi danışıram. Necә әvvәllәr üzvlәrinizi murdarlığa vә Qanunu pozmaq üçün qanunsuzluğa qul kimi tәslim etmişdiniz,

ReferenceBlocks.text: Similarly, today, as slaves, put your body in the service of what is right, and the result will be a life that pleases God.

block.text: elәcә dә indi üzvlәrinizi müqәddәs olmaq üçün salehliyә qul kimi tәslim edin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For when you were servants of sin, you were free in regard to righteousness.

block.text: Çünki siz günahın qulları olanda salehliyә әmәl etmәkdәn azad idiniz.

ReferenceBlocks.text: What fruit then did you have at that time in the things of which you are now ashamed? For the end of those things is death.

block.text: Bәs o zaman nә bәhrә götürdünüz? İndi artıq o şeylәrdәn utanırsınız. Axı onların axırı ölümdür.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But now you have been set free from sin and are slaves of God. With that you get a life completely devoted to him, and the result is that you have eternal life.

block.text: But now you have been set free from sin and are slaves of God. With that you get a life completely devoted to him, and the result is that you have eternal life.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For the wages of sin is death, but the free gift of God is eternal life in Christ Jesus our Lord.

block.text: Çünki günahın әvәzi ölümdür, Allahın әnamı isә Rәbbimiz Mәsih İsada olan әbәdi hәyatdır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ROMANS 7
Or don’t you know, brothers (for I speak to men who know the law), that the law has dominion over a man for as long as he lives?

block.text: Ey qardaşlar, bunu Qanunu bilәnlәrә söylәyirәm, mәgәr bilmirsiniz ki, insan yalnız sağ ikәn qanun onun üzәrindә hökmә malikdir?

ReferenceBlocks.text: For the woman that has a husband is bound by law to the husband while he lives. But if the husband dies, she is discharged from the law of the husband.

block.text: Mәsәlәn, әrli qadın qanunla әrinә o vaxtacan bağlıdır ki, әri sağdır; amma әri öldükdә qadın nikah qanunundan azad olur.

ReferenceBlocks.text: So then if, while the husband lives, she is joined to another man, she would be called an adulteress. But if the husband dies, she is free from the law, so that she is no adulteress, though she is joined to another man.

block.text: Buna görә dә әgәr qadın әri sağ ikәn başqa bir kişiyә әrә gedirsә, zinakar sayılır. Amma әri ölsә, qadın qanundan azad olur vә başqa bir kişiyә әrә getdikdә zinakar olmur.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore, my brothers, you also were made dead to the law through the body of Christ, that you would be joined to another, to him who was raised from the dead, that we might bring forth fruit to God.

block.text: Elәcә dә, qardaşlarım, siz dә Mәsihin bәdәni vasitәsilә Qanuna münasibәtdә ölmüsünüz ki, başqasına, yәni ölülәr arasından dirilmiş Mәsihә mәxsus olasınız; belә ki Allah üçün bәhrә verәk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For when we were in the flesh, the sinful passions which were through the law, worked in our members to bring forth fruit to death.

block.text: Çünki biz cismani tәbiәtә görә yaşayarkәn günahın Qanun vasitәsilә gәlәn hәvәslәri üzvlәrimizdә fәal idi. Buna görә dә biz ölüm üçün bәhrә verirdik.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But now we have been discharged from the law, having died to that in which we were held; so that we serve in newness of the spirit, and not in oldness of the letter.

block.text: Amma indi әvvәlcә әsiri olduğumuz Qanuna münasibәtdә ölüb, ondan azad olduq. Nәticәdә yazılı Qanunun köhnә yolunda deyil, Ruhun yeni yolunda qulluq edirik.

ReferenceBlocks.text: What shall we say then? Is the law sin? May it never be! However, I wouldn’t have known sin, except through the law. For I wouldn’t have known coveting, unless the law had said,

block.text: Bәs nә deyә bilәrik? Qanun günahdırmı? Әsla! Qanun olmasaydı, günahın nә olduğunu bilmәzdim. Әgәr Qanun demәsәydi, tamahın nә olduğunu anlamazdım:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You shall not covet.”

block.text: <<tamah salma>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But sin, finding occasion through the commandment, produced in me all kinds of coveting. For apart from the law, sin is dead.

block.text: Lakin günah bu әmrin vasitәsilә fürsәt tapıb mәndә hәr növ tamah әmәlә gәtirdi; çünki Qanun olmasa, günah ölüdür.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I was alive apart from the law once, but when the commandment came, sin revived,
and I died. The commandment, which was for life, this I found to be for death;

block.text: Bir vaxt Qanun mәndә yox ikәn mәn sağ idim, amma o әmr mәnә gәlәndә günah dirildi,
mәnsә öldüm. Belәcә anladım ki, mәnә hәyat vermәli olan bu әmr mәnә ölüm gәtirdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For sin, finding occasion through the commandment, deceived me, and through it killed me.

block.text: Çünki günah o әmrin vasitәsilә fürsәt tapıb mәni azdırdı vә onunla mәni öldürdü.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore the law indeed is holy, and the commandment holy, and righteous, and good.

block.text: Buna görә dә Qanun müqәddәsdir, әmr dә müqәddәs, әdalәtli vә yaxşıdır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Did then that which is good become death to me? May it never be! In order that sin might be recognized as sin, it produced death in me through what was good. That way, throught he commandment, sin might become utterly sinful.

block.text: Belә çıxır ki, yaxşı olan bir şey mәnә ölüm gәtirdi? Әsla! Mәhz günah, günah olduğu aşkar olsun deyә yaxşı olan bir şeyin vasitәsilә mәnә ölüm gәtirirdi; belә ki günah әmrin vasitәsilә hәdsiz günahlı olduğunu göstәrsin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For we know that the law is spiritual, but I am fleshly, sold under sin.

block.text: Biz bilirik ki, Qanun ruhanidir, mәnsә cismani olub qul kimi günaha satılmışam.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For I don’t know what I am doing. For I don’t practice what I desire to do; but what I hate, that I do.

block.text: Çünki nә iş gördüyümü anlamıram; istәdiyimi deyil, nifrәt etdiyim şeyi edirәm.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But if what I don’t desire, that I do, I consent to the law that it is good.

block.text: Әgәr istәmәdiyimi edirәmsә, onda tәsdiq edirәm ki, Qanun yaxşıdır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: So now it is no more I that do it, but sin which dwells in me.

block.text: Elә isә artıq mәn deyil, daxilimdә yaşayan günah bu işi görür.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For I know that in me, that is, in my flesh, dwells no good thing. For desire is present with me, but I don’t find it doing that which is good.

block.text: Bilirәm ki, daxilimdә, yәni cismani tәbiәtimdә yaxşı bir şey yaşamır; çünki yaxşı şey etmәk istәyi mәndә var, amma onu yerinә yetirmәyә qadir deyilәm.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For the good which I desire, I don’t do; but the evil which I don’t desire, that I practice.

block.text: İstәdiyim yaxşı şeyi etmirәm, amma istәmәdiyim pis şeyi edirәm.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But if what I don’t desire, that I do, it is no more I that do it, but sin which dwells in me.

block.text: Әgәr istәmәdiyim şeyi edirәmsә, onda artıq mәn deyil, daxilimdә yaşayan günah bu işi görür.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I find then the law, that, to me, while I desire to do good, evil is present.

block.text: Belәcә bu nәticәyә gәlirәm ki, yaxşılıq etmәk istәrkәn mәndә pislik üzә çıxır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For in my inward man, I delight in God’s law.

block.text: Bir yandan daxili varlığım Allahın qanunundan zövq alır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But I see a different law in my members, warring against the law of my mind, and bringing me into captivity under the law of sin which is in my members.

block.text: Amma üzvlәrimdә başqa bir qanun da görürәm ki, ağlımın tәsdiq etdiyi Qanunla mübarizә aparır vә üzvlәrimdә olan günah qanununa mәni әsir edir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: What a wretched man I am! Who will deliver me out of the body of this death?

block.text: Necә dә yazıq insanam! Ölümә düçar olan bu bәdәndәn mәni kim xilas edә bilәr?

ReferenceBlocks.text: I thank God through Jesus Christ, our Lord! So then with the mind, I myself serve God’s law, but with the flesh, the sin’s law.

block.text: Rәbbimiz İsa Mәsihin vasitәsilә Allaha şükür olsun! Belәcә mәn ağlımla Allahın qanununa, cismani tәbiәtimlә isә günah qanununa qulluq edirәm.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ROMANS 8
There is therefore now no condemnation to those who are in Christ Jesus, who don’t walk according to the flesh, but according to the Spirit.

block.text: Demәli, indi Mәsih İsada olanlara heç bir mәhkumluq yoxdur.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For the law of the Spirit of life in Christ Jesus made me free from the law of sin and of death.

block.text: Çünki hәyat verәn Ruhun qanunu sәni günah vә ölüm qanunundan Mәsih İsa vasitәsilә azad etdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For what the law couldn’t do because it was weak through the flesh, God did. By sending his own Son in the likeness of sinful flesh and for sin, He condemned sin in the flesh.

block.text: Belәcә cismani tәbiәt üzündәn gücsüz olan Qanunun edә bilmәdiyi şeyi Allah etdi: Öz Oğlunu günahlı cismin bәnzәrindә günah qurbanı olaraq göndәrib günahı Onun cismi ilә mәhkum etdi ki,

ReferenceBlocks.text: In that way, the ordinance of the law might be fulfilled in us, who walk not after the flesh, but after the Spirit.

block.text: Qanunun әdalәtli tәlәblәri artıq cismani tәbiәtә görә yox, Ruha görә hәyat sürәn bizlәrdә yerinә yetsin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For those who live according to the flesh set their minds on the things of the flesh, but those who live according to the Spirit, the things of the Spirit.

block.text: Cismani tәbiәtә görә yaşayanlar cismani şeylәr barәdә düşünür, Ruha görә yaşayanlar isә Ruhla bağlı şeylәr barәdә düşünür.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For the mind of the flesh is death, but the mind of the Spirit is life and peace.

block.text: Cismani tәbiәtә uyan fikirlәr ölüm, Ruha uyan fikirlәrsә hәyat vә sülh gәtirir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The mind of the flesh is hostile towards God; for it is not subject to God’s law, neither indeed can it be.

block.text: Çünki cismani tәbiәtә uyan fikirlәr Allaha qarşı düşmәnçilik edir; belә ki bunlar Allahın qanununa tabe deyil vә ola da bilmәz.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Those who are in the flesh can’t please God.

block.text: Hәmçinin cismani tәbiәtdә olanlar Allahı razı sala bilmәz.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But you are not in the flesh but in the Spirit and so the Spirit of God Dwells in you. But if any man does not have the Spirit of Christ, he does not belong to God.

block.text: Lakin Allahın Ruhu sizdә yaşayırsa, siz cismani tәbiәtdә deyil, Ruhdasınız. Kimdә Mәsihin Ruhu yoxdursa, o adam Mәsihә mәxsus deyil.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If Christ is in you, the body is dead because of sin, but the spirit is alive because of righteousness.

block.text: Әgәr Mәsih sizdәdirsә, bәdәniniz günah sәbәbindәn ölü, ruhunuzsa salehlik sәbәbindәn diridir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But if the Spirit of him who raised up Jesus from the dead dwells in you, he who raised up Christ Jesus from the dead will also give life to your mortal bodies through his Spirit who dwells in you.

block.text: Әgәr İsanı ölülәr arasından Dirildәnin Ruhu sizdә yaşayırsa, Mәsihi ölülәr arasından Dirildәn, sizdә yaşayan Ruhu ilә sizin dә fani bәdәnlәrinizә hәyat verәcәk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: So then, brothers, we are debtors, not to the flesh, to live after the flesh.

block.text: Belәliklә, ey qardaşlar, biz cismani tәbiәtimizә borclu deyilik ki, ona görә yaşayaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For if you live after the flesh, you must die; but if by the Spirit you put to death the deeds of the body, you will live.

block.text: Çünki cismani tәbiәtә görә yaşayırsınızsa, ölәcәksiniz, amma bәdәnin pis әmәllәrini Ruhun vasitәsilә öldürürsünüzsә, yaşayacaqsınız.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For as many as are led by the Spirit of God, these are children of God.

block.text: Allahın Ruhu ilә yönәldilәnlәrin hamısı Allahın oğullarıdır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For you didn’t receive the spirit of slavery that leads you back into fear again. You received the Spirit of adoption, by whom we cry, “Abba! Father!”

block.text: Axı siz kölәlik ruhunu almadınız ki, yenә dә qorxu içindә yaşayasınız; övladlıq Ruhunu aldınız. Elә o Ruhun vasitәsilә Allaha <<Abba, Ata>> deyә nida edirik.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Spirit himself testifies with our spirit that we are children of God.

block.text: Elә Ruh Özü bizim ruhumuzla birgә şәhadәt edir ki, biz Allahın övladlarıyıq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: And if we are children, then heirs; heirs of God, and joint heirs with Christ. Therefore, if we share in his suffering, we also share in his glory.

block.text: And if we are children, then heirs; heirs of God, and joint heirs with Christ. Therefore, if we share in his suffering, we also share in his glory.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For I consider that the sufferings of this present time are not worthy to be compared with the glory which will be revealed toward us.

block.text: Belә düşünürәm ki, çәkdiyimiz indiki әzablar bizә zahir olacaq izzәtlә heç müqayisәyә gәlmәz.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For the creation waits with eager expectation for the children of God to be revealed.

block.text: Yaradılış Allahın oğullarının zahir olmasını böyük hәsrәtlә gözlәyir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For the creation was subjected to vanity, not of its own will, but because of him who subjected it, in hope

block.text: Çünki yaradılış öz iradәsi ilә deyil, onu tәslim edәn Kәsin iradәsi ilә puçluğa tәslim edildi. Amma ümidvardır ki,

ReferenceBlocks.text: that the creation itself also will be delivered from the bondage of decay into the liberty of the glory of the children of God.

block.text: yaradılış özü dә çürümәyә әsir olmaqdan xilas olub, Allah övladlarının izzәtli azadlığına qovuşacaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For we know that the whole creation groans and travails in pain together until now.

block.text: Çünki bilirik ki, bütün yaradılış indiyәcәn birlikdә inildәyib doğuş ağrısı çәkir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Not only so, but ourselves also, who have the first fruits of the Spirit, even we ourselves groan within ourselves, waiting for adoption, the redemption of our body.

block.text: Ancaq tәkcә yaradılış yox, Ruhun nübarını alan biz özümüz dә övladlığa qәbul olunmağımızı, yәni bәdәnimizin satın alınmasını gözlәyәrәk içimizdә inildәyirik.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For we were saved in hope, but hope that is seen is not hope. For who hopes for that which he sees?

block.text: Çünki biz ümidlә xilas olduq. Amma gözә görünәn ümid ümid deyil. Axı kim gördüyü şeyә ümid edәr?

ReferenceBlocks.text: But if we hope for that which we don’t see, we wait for it with patience.

block.text: Amma görmәdiyimiz şeyә ümid edәndә onu sәbirlә gözlәyirik.

ReferenceBlocks.text: In the same way, the Spirit also helps our weaknesses, for we don’t know how to pray as we ought. But the Spirit himself makes intercession for us with groanings which can’t be uttered.

block.text: Belәcә Ruh da bizә zәif olarkәn kömәk edir. Biz nә üçün vә necә dua etmәk lazım olduğunu bilmirik, lakin Ruh Özü dillә deyilmәyәn ahlarla vәsatәtçilik edir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He who searches the hearts knows what is on the Spirit’s mind, because he makes intercession for the saints according to God.

block.text: Ürәklәri sınayan Allah da Ruhun nә düşündüyünü bilir, çünki Ruh Allahın iradәsinә görә müqәddәslәr üçün vәsatәtçilik edir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: We know that all things work together for good for those who love God, to those who are called according to his purpose.

block.text: Biz bilirik ki, hәr şey birlikdә Allahı sevәnlәrin, Onun mәqsәdinә görә çağırılanların xeyrinә işlәyir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For whom he foreknew, he also predestined to be conformed to the image of his Son, that he might be the firstborn among many brothers.

block.text: Çünki Allah qabaqcadan tanıdığı adamları Öz Oğlunun surәtinә uyğunlaşmaq üçün әvvәlcәdәn tәyin etdi ki, O, çoxlu qardaş arasında ilk doğulan olsun;

ReferenceBlocks.text: Whom he predestined, those he also called. Whom he called, those he also justified. Whom he justified, those he also glorified.

block.text: әvvәlcәdәn tәyin etdiyi adamları da çağırdı; çağırdığı adamları da saleh saydı; saleh saydığı adamları da izzәtlәndirdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: What then shall we say about these things? If God is for us, who can be against us?

block.text: Bәs bunlar barәdә nә deyә bilәrik? Әgәr Allah bizimlәdirsә, kim bizә qarşı dura bilәr?

ReferenceBlocks.text: He who didn’t spare his own Son, but delivered him up for us all, how would he not also with him freely give us all things?

block.text: O Öz Oğlunu belә, әsirgәmәyib Onu hamımızın uğrunda ölümә tәslim etdisә, Onunla birgә bütün şeylәri dә bizә lütf etmәyәcәkmi?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Who could bring a charge against God’s chosen ones? It is God who justifies.

block.text: Allahın seçdiyi adamları kim ittiham edә bilәr? Onları saleh sayan Allahdır!

ReferenceBlocks.text: Who is he who condemns? It is Christ who died, yes rather, who was raised from the dead, who is at the right hand of God, who also makes intercession for us.

block.text: Mәhkum edәn kimdir? Ölmüş, üstәlik dirilmiş Mәsih İsa hәm Allahın sağındadır, hәm dә bizim üçün vәsatәtçilik edir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Who shall separate us from the love of Christ? Could oppression, or anguish, or persecution, or famine, or nakedness, or peril, or sword?

block.text: Mәsihin mәhәbbәtindәn bizi kim ayıra bilәr? Әziyyәtmi, sıxıntımı, tәqibmi, aclıqmı, çılpaqlıqmı, tәhlükәmi, qılıncmı?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Even as it is written,

block.text: Necә ki yazılıb:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “For your sake we are killed all day long. We were accounted as sheep for the slaughter.”

block.text: <<Biz gün boyu Sәnin uğrunda öldürülürük, Qurbanlıq qoyunlar sayılırıq>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: No, in all these things, we are more than conquerors through him who loved us.

block.text: Lakin bizi Sevәnin vasitәsilә bütün bunlarda tam qәlәbә qazanırıq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For I am persuaded, that neither death, nor life, nor angels, nor principalities, nor things present, nor things to come, nor powers,

block.text: Çünki әminәm ki, nә ölüm, nә hәyat, nә mәlәklәr, nә başçılar, nә indiki, nә dә gәlәcәk şeylәr, nә qüvvәlәr,

ReferenceBlocks.text: nor height, nor depth, nor any other created thing, will be able to separate us from the love of God, which is in Christ Jesus our Lord.

block.text: nә ucalıq, nә dәrinlik, nә dә başqa bir mәxluq bizi Rәbbimiz Mәsih İsada olan Allah mәhәbbәtindәn ayırmağa qadir olmayacaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ROMANS 9
I tell the truth in Christ. I am not lying, my conscience confirms it in the Holy Spirit.

block.text: Mәsihdә hәqiqәti söylәyirәm, yalan danışmıram, vicdanım dediklәrimi Müqәddәs Ruhda tәsdiq edir ki,

ReferenceBlocks.text: I have great sorrow and unceasing pain in my heart.

block.text: ürәyimdә böyük bir kәdәr, daimi bir iztirab var.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For I could wish that I myself were accursed from Christ for my brothers’ sake, my relatives according to the flesh.

block.text: Çünki qardaşlarımın, yәni cismani soydaşlarımın xatirinә mәn özüm Mәsihdәn uzaqlaşıb lәnәt qazanmağımı istәrdim;

ReferenceBlocks.text: They are Israelites and are the people God chose for himself; the glory, the covenants, the giving of the law, the service, and the promises;

block.text: They are Israelites and are the people God chose for himself; the glory, the covenants, the giving of the law, the service, and the promises;

ReferenceBlocks.text: Theirs are the patriarchs, and from them is traced the human ancestry of Christ, who is God over all, forever praised! Amen.

block.text: Әcdadlar da onlara mәxsusdur, Mәsih dә cismәn onlardandır; O hәr şeyin üzәrindә olan Allahdır ki, Ona әbәdi alqış olsun! Amin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But it is not as though the word of God has come to nothing. For they are not all Israel, that are of Israel.

block.text: Lakin bu o demәk deyil ki, Allahın kәlamı boşa çıxıb. Çünki İsraildәn törәyәnlәrin heç dә hamısı İsrailә mәxsus deyil.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Neither, because they are Abraham’s seed, are they all children. But,

block.text: İbrahimin nәslindәn olanların heç dә hamısı İbrahimin övladları deyil. Amma deyilib:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “In Isaac will your seed be called.”

block.text: <<İshaqdan törәyәnlәr sәnin nәslin adlanacaq>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: That is, it is not the children of the flesh who are children of God, but the children of the promise are counted as a seed.
For this is a word of promise,

block.text: Bu o demәkdir ki, Allahın övladları cismani övladlar deyil, Allahın vәdinә görә doğulan övladlardır ki, bunlar İbrahimin nәsli sayılır.
Çünki belә vәd verilmişdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “At the appointed time I will come, and Sarah will have a son.”

block.text: <<Gәlәn il bu vaxt gәlәcәyәm vә Saranın bir oğlu olacaq>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Not only so, but Rebecca also conceived by one, by our father Isaac.

block.text: Yalnız bu yox, Rivqa da bir kişidәn, yәni babamız İshaqdan hamilә oldu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For being not yet born, neither having done anything good or bad, that the purpose of God according to election might stand, not of works, but of him who calls,
it was said to her,

block.text: Amma iki oğlu hәlә anadan olmamış vә yaxşılıq ya pislik etmәmiş ikәn Allah Rivqaya dedi; belә ki Allahın seçim mәqsәdi onların әmәllәrinә deyil, Öz çağırışına әsaslanaraq bәrqәrar olsun:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The elder will serve the younger.”

block.text: <<böyüyü kiçiyinә qulluq edәcәk>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Even as it is written,

block.text: Necә ki yazılıb:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Jacob I loved, but Esau I hated.”

block.text: <<Yaqubu sevdim, Esava isә nifrәt etdim>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: What shall we say then? Is there unrighteousness with God? May it never be!
For he said to Moses,

block.text: Bәs indi nә deyә bilәrik? Mәgәr Allah әdalәtsizlik edir? Әsla!
Çünki O, Musaya deyir:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I will have mercy on whom I have mercy, and I will have compassion on whom I have compassion.”

block.text: <<Kimә istәsәm, mәrhәmәt edәrәm, kimә istәsәm, rәhm edәrәm>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: So then it is not of him who wills, nor of him who runs, but of God who has mercy.
For the Scripture says to Pharaoh,

block.text: Belәliklә, seçim insanın istәyindәn yaxud sәyindәn deyil, yalnız mәrhәmәt edәn Allahdan asılıdır.
Ona görә dә Müqәddәs Yazıda Allah firona deyir:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “For this very purpose I caused you to be raised up, that I might show in you my power, and that my name might be proclaimed in all the earth.”

block.text: <<Sәni buna görә ucaltdım ki, Öz gücümü sәnin üzәrindә göstәrim vә adım bütün dünyaya elan edilsin>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: So then, he has mercy on whom he desires, and he hardens whom he desires.

block.text: Demәli, Allah kimә istәyirsә, mәrhәmәt edir, kimi istәyirsә, inadkar edir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You will say then to me, “Why does he still find fault? For who withstands his will?”

block.text: İndi sәn mәnә deyә bilәrsәn: <<Bәs Allah daha nә üçün bizi tәqsirkar çıxarır? Mәgәr kimsә Onun iradәsinin әleyhinә gedә bilәr?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But indeed, O man, who are you to reply against God? Will the thing formed ask him who formed it, “Why did you make me like this?”

block.text: Amma, ey insan, sәn kimsәn ki, Allahla mübahisәyә girişirsәn? Mәgәr düzәldilәn bir şey onu düzәldәnә <<Mәni niyә bu cür yaratdın?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Or hasn’t the potter a right over the clay, from the same lump to make one part a vessel for honor, and another for dishonor?

block.text: Mәgәr dulusçunun işlәtdiyi gilә ixtiyarı çatmır ki, hәmin gildәn bir qabı şәrәfli iş üçün, o biri qabı isә şәrәfsiz iş üçün düzәltsin?

ReferenceBlocks.text: What if God, willing to show his wrath, and to make his power known, endured with much patience vessels of wrath made for destruction.

block.text: Әgәr Allah qәzәbini göstәrmәk vә qüdrәtini bildirmәk istәyәrәk qәzәbinә gәlib mәhv olmağa hazırlanmış qablara böyük sәbirlә dözdüsә, biz nә deyә bilәrik?

ReferenceBlocks.text: What if he did this to make known the riches of his glory on vessels of mercy, which he prepared beforehand for glory.

block.text: Mәgәr O bunu etdi ki, qabaqcadan izzәt üçün hazırladığı mәrhәmәt tapan qablara izzәtinin necә zәngin olduğunu bildirsin?

ReferenceBlocks.text: We are the ones he chose, not only from the Jews, but also from the Gentiles.

block.text: O qablar bizik ki, Allah yalnız Yәhudilәr arasından deyil, hәm dә başqa millәtlәr arasından çağırdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As he says also in Hosea,

block.text: Necә ki Huşәnin kitabında deyilir:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I will call them ‘my people,’ which were not my people; and her ‘beloved,’ who was not beloved.”

block.text: <<“Xalqım deyil” dediyimә “Xalqımsan” deyәcәyәm, “Sevdiyim deyil” dediyimә “Sevdiyimsәn” deyәcәyәm>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “It will be that in the place where it was said to them, ‘You are not my people,’ There they will be called ‘children of the living God.’”

block.text: <<Onlara “siz Mәnim xalqım deyilsiniz” deyilәn yerdә “siz var olan Allahın övladlarısınız” deyilәcәk>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Isaiah cries concerning Israel,

block.text: Yeşaya da İsrail barәdә belә nida edir:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If the number of the children of Israel are as the sand of the sea, it is the remnant who will be saved;

block.text: <<İsrail övladlarının sayı dәniz qumu qәdәr çox olsa belә, Ancaq sağ qalanları xilas olacaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: for He will finish the work and cut it short in righteousness, because the LORD will make a short work upon the earth.”

block.text: Çünki Rәbb yer üzündә hökmünü Tam vә tez yerinә yetirәcәk>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As Isaiah has said before,

block.text: Yeşayanın qabaqcadan söylәdiyi kimi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Unless the Lord of Armies had left us a seed, we would have become like Sodom, and would have been made like Gomorrah.”

block.text: <<Әgәr Ordular Rәbbi Bizim xalqdan bir neçә Sağ qalan adam qoymasaydı, Biz Sodom kimi olardıq, Homorraya bәnzәyәrdik>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: What shall we say then? That the Gentiles, who didn’t follow after righteousness, attained to righteousness, even the righteousness which is of faith.

block.text: Bәs nә deyә bilәrik? Salehliyin ardınca getmәyәn başqa millәtlәr salehliyi, yәni imanla gәlәn salehliyi әldә etdilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Israel, following after a law of righteousness, didn’t arrive at the law of righteousness.

block.text: Amma salehlik göstәrәn Qanunun ardınca gedәn İsrail xalqı bu Qanuna çata bilmәdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Why? Because they didn’t seek it by faith, but as it were by works of the law. They stumbled over the stumbling stone;
even as it is written,

block.text: Nә üçün? Çünki imanla yox, әmәllәrlә gedirdilәr. Belәcә büdrәmә daşına ilişdilәr.
Necә ki yazılıb:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, I lay in Zion a stumbling stone and a rock of offense; and no one who believes in him will be disappointed.”

block.text: <<Budur, Sionda bir büdrәmә daşı vә yıxıdan qaya qoyuram. Ona iman edәn kәs utandırılmaz>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ROMANS 10
Brothers, my heart’s desire and my prayer to God is for Israel, that they may be saved.

block.text: Ey qardaşlar, İsraillilәrin xilasını ürәkdәn arzulayıram vә bunun üçün Allaha dua edirәm.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For I testify about them that they have a zeal for God, but not according to knowledge.

block.text: Onların barәsindә şәhadәt edirәm ki, Allah naminә qeyrәt çәkirlәr, amma bu qeyrәt biliyә әsaslanmır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For being ignorant of God’s righteousness, and seeking to establish their own righteousness, they didn’t subject themselves to the righteousness of God.

block.text: Çünki onlar Allahdan gәlәn salehliyi anlamayıb öz salehliklәrini bәrqәrar etmәyә çalışmaqla Allahın salehliyinә tabe olmadılar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For Christ is the fulfillment of the law for righteousness to everyone who believes.

block.text: Mәsih Qanunun sonu olub ki, iman gәtirәn hәr kәs saleh sayılsın.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For Moses writes about the righteousness of the law,

block.text: Musa Qanunla gәlәn salehlik haqqında belә yazır:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The one who does them will live by them.”

block.text: <<Bu şeylәri yerinә yetirәn adam bunların sayәsindә yaşayacaq>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the righteousness which is of faith says this, “Don’t say in your heart, ‘Who will ascend into heaven?’ (that is, to bring Christ down);”

block.text: Amma imanla gәlәn salehlik barәdә belә deyilir: <<Ürәyindә demә ki, “Kim göylәrә, yәni Mәsihi endirmәyә çıxacaq?”

ReferenceBlocks.text: “or, ‘Who will descend into the abyss?’ (that is, to bring Christ up from the dead.)
But what does it say?”

block.text: ya da “Kim dibsiz dәrinliyә, yәni Mәsihi ölülәr arasından qaldırmağa enәcәk?”>>
Bәs onda nә deyilir?

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The word is near you, in your mouth, and in your heart”

block.text: <<Kәlam sәnә çox yaxındır, o sәnin dilindә vә ürәyindәdir>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: that is, the word of faith, which we preach:

block.text: Biz elә hәmin iman kәlamını vәz edirik:

ReferenceBlocks.text: that if you will confess with your mouth that Jesus is Lord, and believe in your heart that God raised him from the dead, you will be saved.

block.text: әgәr sәn İsanın Rәbb olduğunu dilinlә iqrar edib Allahın Onu ölülәr arasından diriltdiyinә ürәkdәn inansan, xilas olacaqsan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For with the heart, one believes unto righteousness; and with the mouth confession is made unto salvation.
For the Scripture says,

block.text: Çünki insan ürәkdәn iman etmәklә saleh sayılır vә dili ilә iqrar etmәklә xilas olur.
Belә ki Müqәddәs Yazıda deyilir:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Whoever believes in him will not be disappointed.”

block.text: <<Ona iman edәn hәr kәs utandırılmayacaq>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For there is no distinction between Jew and Greek; for the same Lord is Lord of all, and is rich to all who call on him.
For,

block.text: Burada Yәhudi ilә Yunan arasında fәrq yoxdur, hamısının Rәbbi birdir vә Onu çağıranların hamısına bol bәrәkәt verir.
Çünki

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Whoever will call on the name of the Lord will be saved.”

block.text: <<Rәbbin adını çağıran hәr kәs xilas olacaq>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: How then will they call on him in whom they have not believed? How will they believe in him whom they have not heard? How will they hear without a preacher?

block.text: Bәs onlar iman etmәdiklәri Şәxsi necә çağıracaqlar? Barәsindә eşitmәdiklәri Şәxsә necә iman edәcәklәr? Vәz edәn olmasa, necә eşidәcәklәr?

ReferenceBlocks.text: And how will they preach unless they are sent? As it is written:

block.text: Göndәrilmәsәlәr, necә vәz edәcәklәr? Necә ki yazılıb:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “How beautiful are the feet of those who preach the Good News of peace, who bring glad tidings of good things!”

block.text: <<Xoş xәbәri müjdәlәyәnin qәdәmlәri necә dә gözәldir!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But they didn’t all listen to the glad news. For Isaiah says,

block.text: Amma Müjdәyә hamı qulaq asmadı. Çünki Yeşaya deyir:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, who has believed our report?”

block.text: <<Ya Rәbb, xәbәrimizә kim inandı?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: So faith comes by hearing, and hearing by the word of God.

block.text: Belәliklә, iman eşitmәkdәn, eşitmәk dә Mәsihin kәlamı vasitәsilә yaranır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But I ask, didn’t they hear? Yes, most certainly,

block.text: Lakin soruşuram: mәgәr onlar eşitmәdilәr? Әlbәttә ki, eşitdilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Their sound went out into all the earth, their words to the ends of the world.”

block.text: <<Avazları bütün dünyaya yayıldı, Sözlәri yerin ucqarlarına çatdı>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But I ask, didn’t Israel know? First Moses says,

block.text: Bir dә soruşuram: mәgәr İsrail anlamadı? Musa ilk olaraq deyir:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I will provoke you to jealousy with that which is no nation, with a nation void of understanding I will make you angry.”

block.text: <<Mәn sizi xalq olmayanlarla qısqandıracağam, Axmaq bir millәtlә qәzәblәndirәcәyәm>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Isaiah is very bold, and says,

block.text: Yeşaya isә cәsarәtlә deyir:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I was found by those who didn’t seek me. I was revealed to those who didn’t ask for me.”

block.text: <<Rәbb deyir: “Mәni axtarmayanlar tәrәfindәn tapıldım, Mәni soruşmayanlara Mәn zühur etdim”>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But as to Israel he says,

block.text: İsrail barәdә isә belә deyir:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “All day long I stretched out my hands to a disobedient and contrary people.”

block.text: <<Gün boyu itaәtsiz, dikbaş xalqa әllәrimi uzadıb durdum>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ROMANS 11
I ask then, did God reject his people? May it never be! For I also am an Israelite, a descendant of Abraham, of the tribe of Benjamin.

block.text: Belәliklә, soruşuram: mәgәr Allah Öz xalqını rәdd etdi? Әsla! Çünki mәn özüm dә İbrahim nәslindәn, Binyamin qәbilәsindәn olan bir İsrailliyәm.

ReferenceBlocks.text: God didn’t reject his people, which he foreknew. Or don’t you know what the Scripture says about Elijah? How he pleads with God against Israel:

block.text: Allah qabaqcadan tanıdığı Öz xalqını rәdd etmәdi. Mәgәr siz bilmirsiniz ki, Müqәddәs Yazıda İlyas barәdә nә deyilir? İlyas İsraildәn Allaha şikayәt edib deyir:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, they have killed your prophets, they have broken down your altars; and I am left alone, and they seek my life.”

block.text: <<Ya Rәbb! Sәnin peyğәmbәrlәrini öldürdülәr, qurbangahlarını dağıtdılar. Tәkcә mәn qaldım, onlar canımı almaq üçün mәni dә axtarırlar>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But how does God answer him?

block.text: Bәs Allahdan ona hansı cavab gәldi?

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I have reserved for myself seven thousand men, who have not bowed the knee to Baal.”

block.text: <<Mәn Özüm üçün Baal qarşısında diz çökmәmiş yeddi min adamı saxlamışam>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Even so then at this present time also there is a remnant according to the election of grace.

block.text: Belәcә indi dә Allahın lütfü ilә seçilmiş sağ qalanlar var.

ReferenceBlocks.text: And if by grace, then it is no longer of works; otherwise grace is no longer grace. But if it is of works, it is no longer grace; otherwise work is no longer work.

block.text: Әgәr bu, lütflә oldusa, daha әmәllәrlә deyil; yoxsa lütf daha lütf olmaz.

ReferenceBlocks.text: What then? That which Israel seeks for, that he didn’t obtain, but the chosen ones obtained it, and the rest were hardened.
According as it is written,

block.text: Onda nә deyә bilәrik? İsrail axtardığını әldә etmәdi, seçilmişlәr әldә etdilәr; digәrlәri isә inadkar oldu.
Necә ki yazılıb:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “God gave them a spirit of stupor, eyes that they should not see, and ears that they should not hear, to this very day.”

block.text: <<Allah onları dәrin yuxuya saldı, Onlara bu günәdәk görmәyәn gözlәr, Eşitmәyәn qulaqlar verdi>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: David says,

block.text: Davud da belә deyir:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Let their table be made a snare, and a trap, a stumbling block, and a retribution to them.

block.text: <<Süfrәlәri onlara tәlә, tor, Büdrәmә daşı vә cәza olsun.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Let their eyes be darkened, that they may not see. Bow down their back always.”

block.text: Gözlәrinә qara gәlsin, görmәsinlәr, Bellәri hәmişә bükülü qalsın!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: I ask then, did they stumble that they might fall? May it never be! But by their fall salvation has come to the Gentiles, to provoke them to jealousy.

block.text: Belәliklә, soruşuram: mәgәr İsraillilәr bir daha ayağa qalxmamaq üçün büdrәyib-yıxıldılar? Әsla! Amma onların tәqsiri başqa millәtlәrin xilasına sәbәb oldu ki, İsraillilәrdә qibtә oyandırsın.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Their disobedience has brought great benefits to the world, and their failure as a people has brought great benefits to those who are not Jewish. So when the Jews participate fully in salvation, the benefits are even greater.

block.text: Әgәr onların tәqsiri dünyaya zәnginlik, onların qüsuru da başqa millәtlәrә zәnginlik gәtirdisә, gör onların bütövlüyü necә böyük zәnginlik gәtirәcәk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For I speak to you who are Gentiles. Since then as I am an apostle to Gentiles, I glorify my ministry.

block.text: Lakin, ey başqa millәtlәr, sizә bildirirәm: mәn başqa millәtlәrә göndәrilәn hәvari olduğuma görә öz xidmәtimi izzәtli sayıram ki,

ReferenceBlocks.text: I do this so that by any means I may provoke to jealousy those who are my flesh, and may save some of them.

block.text: bәlkә soydaşlarımda qibtә hissi oyandırıb bәzilәrini xilas edә bilim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For if the rejection of them is the reconciling of the world, what would their acceptance be, but life from the dead?

block.text: Çünki onların rәdd edilmәsi dünyanın Allahla barışması demәkdirsә, onların qәbul edilmәsi ölülәr arasından hәyata dönmәk deyilmi?

ReferenceBlocks.text: If the first fruit is holy, so is the lump. If the root is holy, so are the branches.

block.text: Әgәr xәmirin ilk hissәsi müqәddәsdirsә, demәk, xәmirin hamısı müqәddәsdir; әgәr kök müqәddәsdirsә, budaqlar da müqәddәsdir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But some of the branches were broken off, and you, being a wild olive, were grafted in among them. You became partakers with them of the root and of the richness of the olive tree.

block.text: Ancaq filiallarının bir qopardılmış edilmiş, və bir yabanı zeytun olan, onların arasında ilə grafted edilmiş, kök və zeytun ağacı zənginliyi onlara ilə partaker oldu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Don’t boast over the branches. If you boast, it is not you who support the root, but the root supports you.
